title: Rob Gronkowski announces that he will ‘retire as a Patriot’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rob Gronkowski will sign a one-day contract to retire with the New England Patriots this week.
Gronkowski spent nine seasons with the Patriots, followed by two seasons with Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
He is regarded as one of the greatest tight ends, holding several franchise and NFL records.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Buccaneers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookies TreVeyon Henderson, Kyle Williams, and Elijah Ponder made significant contributions in the 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Drake Maye threw for crucial plays despite a 51% completion rate and extended interception streak to three games.
Tight ends Austin Hooper and Hunter Henry were ineffective, combining for one catch despite multiple targets.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ impressive road win over Buccaneers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots extend win streak to seven games with 28-23 victory over the Buccaneers.
Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams score three touchdowns, contributing 222 of Patriots' 435 yards.
Quarterback Drake Maye throws for 270 yards and two touchdowns despite a fourth-quarter interception.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Transit Police officer Jonathan Daveiga charged with drunk driving after allegedly crashing into a pole in Boston.
Daveiga claimed he had two drinks before crash; officers noted signs of intoxication, including slurred speech and vomit.
Officer placed on 'modified duty'; he pleaded not guilty and is due in Boston Municipal Court on December 19.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine employees at Allston Car Wash remain in custody following ICE's November 4 raid despite holding work permits.
Attorney Todd Pomerleau reports difficulties accessing information on the detainees' status and inadequate responses from ICE.
Rep. Ayanna Pressley and other local officials condemned the arrests, expressing support for the detained workers' families.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Comedian Nikki Glaser hosted 'Saturday Night Live' on November 8, with musical guest Sombr.
Glaser's popularity surged after her standout performance at the 2024 Tom Brady roast.
Highlights included Glaser's monologue and Pete Davidson's return to the 'Weekend Update' desk.

title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored a crucial goal for the Bruins, securing a 5-3 win over the Maple Leafs in Toronto.
Minten, previously a top Toronto prospect, was traded to Boston last season as part of the Brandon Carlo deal.
The Bruins have now achieved six consecutive victories with Minten praised by Coach Marco Sturm as the game's standout player.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame alongside Joe Thornton on November 8, 2025.
Chara, a former long-time Bruins captain, was celebrated for his achievements including a 2011 Stanley Cup win and a Norris Trophy.
During the induction festivities in Toronto, Chara expressed awe and emotion upon seeing his Hall of Fame plaque.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Red Sox are predicted to be active in MLB free agency, with Alex Bregman, Kyle Schwarber, and Pete Alonso as key targets.
Boston is reportedly willing to spend, having about $25 million below the first luxury tax threshold.
Insiders differ on predictions, with varied opinions on the Red Sox re-signing Bregman or acquiring players like Murakami and Cease.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway celebrating 20 years since his debut album 'Get Lifted'.
Legend's performance included a mix of tracks from his debut album and covers like 'The Staple Singers' Let's Do It Again'.
The concert featured Legend's varied musical style, with tracks blending R&B, gospel, and contemporary hits in his setlist.
